chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)
Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Fritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William James Fritz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William James Fritz was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • William James Fritz was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • William James Fritz was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant William James Fritz in court with attorney Roy E Hegard.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Cross states Motion to Challenge Prior 1999 conviction.  ADA Cross surrenders on that issue.  Amended  4th Restricted Controlled Substance, OAR, .possess cocaine, Fail to Install IID,  Amended Information filed.  Rights/elements reviewed.  No contest plea entered.  Court accepted plea, JOC entered. Sentencing Statements.    On Ct 1, OAR, court imposed 6 months jail with huber commencing 9-23-2016 @ 7 pm , costs $243.00 due 60 days or payplan.  On Ct 2 cocaine, court withheld sentence on 2 years probation, costs $243.00 to probation. AODA and comply.   , Ct 3, OWI 4th:  court withheld sentence, placed on 2 years probation, 6 months jail with huber consecutive to Ct 1  Fine $2198.00 to probation, $200 DNA surcharge submit DNA sample, 36 month revocation, 36 month IID, AODA, May transfer to Winnebago County.  Good time allowed.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  CT 4 IID dismissed.  15tr1120 dismissed.  No sentence credit.  Must report to probation by  4pm 9-9-16.  Bond conditions remain until reports to probation.
